titleStmt.title: Die September 29. 1642. The Lords and Commons in Parliament do conceive and find it so necessary that 1000. dragoones, with some troopes of horse should be raised speedily, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: by L.N. for E. Husbands and I. Frank, and are to be sold at their shops in the Middle Temple, and next dore to the Kings Haed [sic] in Fleetstreete,

notesStmt.note: At foot of text: Orderep [sic] by the House of Commins [sic] that this be forthwith printed and puplished [sic]. Hen: E-singe, Cleric, Payliament. [sic] D. Com.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: dore to the Kings Haed [sic] in Fleetstreete
their shops in the Middle Temple
